page.title: 13Widley Farm
page.content: The total land of Widley Farm is 203 acres. 10 acres are used for growing potatoes. 32 acres for corn and 158 acres for grazing. They have 117 cows, 53 calves, 57 heifers altogether 227 cattle. 638000 litres of milk is expected each year. The farmhouse was built in 1720 along with some barns although many were damaged in a recent fire. The farm has already seen seen four generations of the same family. In the First World War there were army tents in the fields and in the second search lights and guns. This farm has really moved through history.
